def.title: What does CIO mean?
def.p: CIO stands for Coroutine-based I/O. Usually we call it to an engine that uses Kotlin and Coroutines to implement the logic implementing an IETF RFC or another protocol without relying on external JVM-based libraries.

def.title: Does Ktor provide a way to catch IPC signals (e.g. SIGTERM or SIGINT) so the server shutdown can be handled gracefully?
def.p: If you are running an EngineMain, it will be handled automatically. Otherwise, you need to handle it manually. You can use the Runtime.getRuntime().addShutdownHook JVM's facility.

def.title: How do I get the client IP behind a proxy?
def.p: The call.request.origin property gives connection information about the original caller (the proxy) if the proxy provides proper headers, and the ForwardedHeaderSupport plugin is installed.

def.title: How to fix 'java.lang.IllegalStateException: No instance for key AttributeKey: Locations'?
def.p: You get this error if you try to use the Locations plugin without actually installing it.

def.title: How can I test the latest commits on main?
def.p: You can get Ktor nightly builds from jetbrains.space. Learn more from Early Access Program.

def.title: My route is not being executed. How can I debug it?
def.p: Ktor provides a tracing mechanism to help troubleshooting routing decisions. Check the Tracing the routing decisions section.

def.title: How to resolve 'io.ktor.server.engine.BaseApplicationResponse$ResponseAlreadySentException: Response has already been sent'?
def.p: This means that you, or a plugin or interceptor, have already called call.respond* functions, and you are calling it again.

def.title: How can I subscribe to Ktor events?
def.p: See the Application monitoring page to learn more.

def.title: How to resolve 'Exception in thread main com.typesafe.config.ConfigException$Missing: No configuration setting found for key ktor'?
def.p: This means that Ktor was not able to find the application.conf file. Re-check that it is in the resources folder, and that the resources folder is marked as such. You can consider to set up a project using the project generator or the IntelliJ plugin to have a working project as the base.

def.title: Can I use Ktor on Android?
def.p: Yes, Ktor servers and clients are known to work on Android 5 (API 21) or greater, at least with the Netty engine.

def.title: Why 'CURL -I' returns a '404 Not Found'?
def.p: CURL -I is an alias of CURL --head that performs HEAD requests. By default, Ktor doesn't handle HEAD requests for GET handlers. To enable this capability, install the AutoHeadResponse plugin.

def.title: How to resolve an infinite redirect when using the 'HttpsRedirect' plugin
def.p: The most probable cause is that your backend is behind a reverse-proxy or a load balancer, and that this intermediary is making normal HTTP requests to your backend, thus the HttpsRedirect plugin inside your Ktor backend believes that it is a normal HTTP request and responds with the redirect.

Normally, reverse-proxies send some headers describing the original request (like it was HTTPS, or the original IP address), and there is a plugin ForwardedHeaderSupport to parse those headers so the HttpsRedirect plugin knows that the original request was HTTPS.
